dmca.title: [ABUSE] copyright infringments on your site-who do we contact
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

 

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital
Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

 

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim.

 

Please visit our web site at  <http://www.theplanet.com/legal>
www.theplanet.com/legal.

 

Legal Response Team

THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.


  _____  

From: pixintl [mailto:pixintl@pixintl.com] 
Sent: Wednesday, January 04, 2006 12:16 AM
To: legal-response2@theplanet.com
Cc: legal@pixintl.com
Subject: Re: [ABUSE] copyright infringments on your site-who do we contact


3 Jan 2006

By ignoring my request to remove MY copyrighted images from said website you
have made yourself party to a copyright infringement and piracy lawsuit.You
had ample time to remove my celebrity images. 
I am the photographer of the images.They copyright was registered with the
US Copyright office which puts me in a positiion to collect $150,000 per
image as well as all legal costs.



Linda Matlow,PixIntl.
president
Photography & Imaging since 1978



On Dec 27, 2005, at 4:04 PM, Legal Response wrote:



To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital
Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim.

Please visit our web site at  <http://www.theplanet.com/legal>
www.theplanet.com/legal.

Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.

  _____  

From: pixintl [mailto:pixintl@pixintl.com] 
Sent: Tuesday, December 27, 2005 2:35 PM
To: Legal Response
Cc: legal@pixintl.com
Subject: Re: [ABUSE] copyright infringments on your site-who do we contact


PS- 
If you'd read your own terms here you'd see that your pster has violated the
US Copyright act.
The site where he stole the images from is not a FREE SITE.It is a site that
licenses my images for MONEY to legit publications.

Linda Matlow,Pix International,L.L.C.




"Compliance with Law

Customer shall not post, transmit, re-transmit or store material on or
through any of Services or Products which, in the sole judgment of the
Company (i) is in violation of any local, state, federal or non-United
States law or regulation, (ii) threatening, obscene, indecent, defamatory or
that otherwise could adversely a"









On Dec 27, 2005, at 2:24 PM, Legal Response wrote:


To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital
Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim.

Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/legal.

Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.


-----Original Message-----
From: Policy Enforcement [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] 
Sent: Friday, December 23, 2005 7:41 AM
To: copyright@theplanet.com
Cc: Policy Enforcement
Subject: Fwd: [ABUSE] copyright infringments on your site-who do we contact


For your review.

Martin Gaston
Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/legal/

Begin forwarded message:


From: pixintl <pixintl@pixintl.com>
Date: December 22, 2005 11:32:31 PM CST
To: <abuse@theplanet.com>
Cc: Linda Matlow <pixintl@pixintl.com>
Subject: [ABUSE] copyright infringments on your site-who do we contact
X-Spam-Level: ---------------------------------------------------
X-Spam-Level: ---------------------------------------------------

22 Dec 2005
Many of our copyrighted images(and we do copyright them) are being 
hosted by your site,"Supload.com"We want the legal name and contact 
info for the poster as we intend to invoice them for these 
unauthorized uses.Failure to comply will result in a willful 
infringement copyright suit from our company.

Linda Matlow
pixintl.com











  <http://xpostmail.com/06ea9ac9adf25e60272dac2e1131836eworker.jpg>
